Key Match Events: Argentina defeated Chile 3-0 in World Cup qualifying on Thursday.
Goals from Alexis Mac Allister, Julian Alvarez, and Paulo Dybala sealed the victory.
Alexis Mac Allister scored the opening goal three minutes into the second half.
Julian Alvarez scored a long-range stunner in the 84th minute.
Paulo Dybala scored the third goal in stoppage-time.
Pre-Game Insights: Argentina paid tribute to Angel Di Maria, who announced his international retirement after winning the Copa America.
Post-Match Reflections: Lionel Scaloni's side stayed atop the CONMEBOL standings in World Cup qualifying with 18 points out of 21.
Lionel Scaloni should be thrilled with the team's performance, especially in the second half.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Emiliano Martinez made an outstanding save in the first half.
Nicolas Otamendi completed 96 percent of his 84 total passes.
Giovani Lo Celso bagged an assist for Julian Alvarez's goal.
Alejandro Garnacho assisted on Paulo Dybala's third goal.
